Recomendar Artículos por Autor
Este plugin inserta una lista de artículos del mismo autor en la página resumen
Mas artículos del mismo autor

Obs.: Este plugin de artículo requiere al menos una estadística/reporte para ser habilitado. Si tu plugin de estadística provee más de una métrica, entonces por favor selecciona una métrica principal en la configuración del administrador y/o en configuración de la revista.
Visor de artículo eLife Lens
Provee soporte de renderizado JATS XML usando eLife Lens.
URN
This plugin enables the assignment of the Uniform Resource Names to the issues, articles and galleys in OJS.
Please configure the URN plug-in to be able to manage and use URNs in OJS:
Journal Content
Please choose the objects URNs should be assigned to.
Please select the publishing objects that will have Uniform Resource Names (URN) assigned:
Issues
Articles
Galleys
URN Prefix
The URN prefix is the fix, never changing part of the URN (e.g. "urn:nbn:de:0000-").
The URN prefix pattern must be in the form "urn:"<NID>":"<NSS>.
URN Suffix
A URN suffix can take any form, but must be unique among all publishing objects with the same URN prefix assigned:

Use the pattern entered below to generate URN suffixes. Use %j for journal initials, %v for the volume number, %i for the issue number, %Y for the year, %a for the OJS article ID, %g for the OJS galley ID, %f for the OJS file ID, %p for the page number and %x for "Custom Identifier".
For example, vol%viss%ipp%p could create the URN suffix "vol3iss2pp230".
for issues
for articles
for galleys
Please enter the URN suffix pattern for issues.
Please enter the URN suffix pattern for articles.
Please enter the URN suffix pattern for galleys.
Use default patterns.

%j.v%vi%i for issues
%j.v%vi%i.%a for articles
%j.v%vi%i.%a.g%g for galleys.
Enter an individual URN suffix for each published item. You'll find an additional URN input field on each item's metadata page.
Check Number
The check number will be automatically calculated and added at the end, as the last digit of an URN.
Namespace
Choose
The persistent identifier namespace usually needed for the registration (e.g. at the Deutsche Nationalbibliothek).
Resolver URL
(e.g. http://nbn-resolving.de/)
Please enter the resolver URL.
Reassign URNs

If you change your URN configuration, URNs that have already been assigned will not be affected. Once the URN configuration is saved, use this button to clear all existing URNs so that the new settings will take effect with existing objects.
Are you sure you wish to delete all existing URNs?
URN
issue
article
galley
The URN cannot be assigned because the custom suffix is missing.
The URN cannot be assigned because it contains an unresolved pattern.
What you see is a preview of the URN. Select the checkbox and save the form to assign the URN.
The URN is assigned to this {$pubObjectType}.
The given URN suffix is already in use for another published item. Please enter a unique URN suffix for each item.
Clear URN
Are you sure you wish to delete the existing URN?
Clear Issue Objects URNs
Are you sure you wish to delete the existing issue objects URNs?
Use the following option to clear URNs of all objects (articles and galleys) currently scheduled for this issue.
Add Check Number
Assign the URN {$pubId} to this {$pubObjectType}
The URN cannot be assigned because the custom suffix is missing.
The URN {$pubId} cannot be assigned because it contains an unresolved pattern.
The URN {$pubId} has been assigned.
The check number is missing.
DOI
This plugin enables the assignment of the Digital Object Identifiers to issues, articles and galleys in OJS.
DOI:
Please configure the DOI plug-in to be able to manage and use DOIs in OJS:
Journal Content
Please choose the objects DOIs should be assigned to.
Please select the publishing objects that will have Digital Object Identifiers (DOI) assigned:
Issues
Articles
Galleys
DOI Prefix
The DOI Prefix is assigned by registration agencies (e.g. CrossRef) and is in the format 10.xxxx (e.g. 10.1234):
The DOI prefix is mandatory and must be in the form 10.xxxx.
DOI Suffix
A DOI suffix can take any form, but must be unique among all publishing objects with the same DOI prefix assigned:

Use the pattern entered below to generate DOI suffixes. Use %j for journal initials, %v for the volume number, %i for the issue number, %Y for the year, %a for the OJS article ID, %g for the OJS galley ID, %f for the OJS file ID, %p for the page number and %x for "Custom Identifier".
For example, vol%viss%ipp%p could create a DOI such as 10.1234/vol3iss2pp230
for issues
for articles
for galleys
Use default patterns.

%j.v%vi%i for issues
%j.v%vi%i.%a for articles
%j.v%vi%i.%a.g%g for galleys.
Enter an individual DOI suffix for each published item. You'll find an additional DOI input field on each item's meta-data page.
Please enter the DOI suffix pattern for issues.
Please enter the DOI suffix pattern for articles.
Please enter the DOI suffix pattern for galleys.
Reassign DOIs

If you change your DOI configuration, DOIs that have already been assigned will not be affected. Once the DOI configuration is saved, use this button to clear all existing DOIs so that the new settings will take effect with existing objects.
Are you sure you wish to delete all existing DOIs?
DOI
issue
article
galley
The DOI cannot be assigned because the custom suffix is missing.
The DOI cannot be assigned because it contains an unresolved pattern.
What you see is a preview of the DOI. Select the checkbox and save the form to assign the DOI.
The DOI is assigned to this {$pubObjectType}.
The given DOI suffix is already in use for another published item. Please enter a unique DOI suffix for each item.
Clear DOI
Are you sure you wish to delete the existing DOI?
Clear Issue Objects DOIs
Are you sure you wish to delete the existing issue objects DOIs?
Use the following option to clear DOIs of all objects (articles and galleys) currently scheduled for this issue.
Assign the DOI {$pubId} to this {$pubObjectType}
The DOI cannot be assigned because the custom suffix is missing.
The DOI {$pubId} cannot be assigned because it contains an unresolved pattern.
The DOI {$pubId} has been assigned.
Public Identifiers XML Plugin
Import and export public identifiers

Usage: {$scriptName} {$pluginName} [command] ... Commands: import [xmlFileName] [journal_path] [user_name] export [xmlFileName] [journal_path] issues [issueId1] [issueId2] ... export [xmlFileName] [journal_path] issue [issueId]
Export public identifiers
Export public identifiers
Select Issue
Please select issues, for whose objects you whish to export the public identifiers.
Import public identifiers
This plugin supports the import of the public identifiers based on the pubIds.dtd Document Type Definition.
Import Results
Import Errors
One or more errors occurred during import. Please check to ensure that the format of the import file correctly matches the specification. Specific details of the import errors are listed below.
Import Success
Successfully-imported public identifiers are listed below.
ERROR:
The specified journal path, "{$journalPath}", does not exist.
The specified user, "{$userName}", does not exist.
No issue matched the specified issue ID "{$issueId}".
Could not write to the file "{$fileName}".
The upload failed; please ensure that uploads are allowed on your server and that the file is not too big for your PHP and web server configuration.
This plugin does not support the supplied root node "{$rootName}". Please ensure that the file is correctly formed and try again.
An unknown object type "{$pubObjectType}" was specified in the "pubObjectType" attribute of the element with the value "{$pubId}".
The object "{$pubObjectType}" with ID = {$pubObjectId} specified in the element with the value "{$pubId}" deos not exist for this journal.
Public identifier of the type "{$pubIdType}" for the object {$pubObjectType} with ID = {$pubObjectId} already exists.
The public identifier "{$pubId}" is already in use by another object.
Your import file contains a public identifier type "{$pubIdType}" that no pubId plugin can handle. Please install and/or activate the corresponding pubId plugin before trying to import this dataset.
